Michigan Ongoing Health & Safety Training Refresher 2023
Section 4: Handling & Storage of Hazardous Materials & Appropriate Disposal of Bio-contaminants

Proper Use & Storage of Toxic Substances

Let's discuss the proper use and storage of toxic substances. 

Use products as they are recommended by their manufacturer 

Per the recommendation of the manufacturer, use products for their intended purpose only. Follow manufacturers directions for diluting and mixing. Directions can be found on the product label. A hint for reading small print on labels is to take a picture with your phone and enlarge it. 

Store items in original labeled containers out of reach of children 

Store items only in their original containers with the label intact.  Never store hazardous products in food containers.  Make sure items are out of the reach of children.  Lock medications.  Note that now that Michigan has legalized recreational use of marijuana it is important to ensure it is locked away from children, especially the edibles. 

Keep Safety Data Sheets (SDS) readily available to staff for all hazardous products 

It is recommended that all hazardous materials at your child care site have a Safety Data Sheet (SDS).  These sheets need to be kept in a notebook for easy staff access. 

Never mix hazardous materials with other products 

Never mix hazardous materials with other products.  Incompatible products might react, ignite, or explode.
